sourceDesc.p: This publication constitutes a remediation of the printed Inns of Court collection. Information on original sources for transcriptions can be accessed via the Document Descriptions.
For a full list of REED collections, editors, executive board members, and staff, please visit http://reed.utoronto.ca/people

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the taxon prefix are pointers to entities in the taxonomy.xml file. For example, taxon:church dereferences to taxonomy.xml#church.
Private URIs using the gloss prefix are pointers to entities in the glossary.xml file. For example, gloss:histrio-1 dereferences to glossary.xml#histrio-1.

projectDesc.p: Records of Early English Drama (REED) is an international scholarly project that is establishing for the first time the context from which the drama of Shakespeare and his contemporaries grew. Founded in 1976, REED has worked since then to locate, transcribe, and edit historical documents containing evidence of drama, secular music, and other communal entertainment and ceremony from the Middle Ages until 1642, when the Puritans closed the London theatres.

mods:mods.mods:abstract: "Surviving Pension Books date from 1568–9. William Dugdale consulted an earlier volume, now lost. His Origines Juridiciales (1666) preserves entries from 1529–30 and 1550–1 (see pp 58–9, 74; see p lxxvi for document description). Financial accounts were entered in the Pension Book to 1582–3, and thereafter in Ledger Books. The library holds microfiche of the Pension Books produced in 1976 (skipping ff 234v–5), and digital photos of PEN/1/1 (Pension Book 1), taken in 2006 when the volume was disbound for conservation. The standard essential publication is Reginald J. Fletcher (ed), The Pension Book of Gray’s Inn (Records of the Honourable Society)1569–1669, vol 1 (London, 1901)."
mods:mods.mods:accessCondition: Use of this public-domain resource is governed by the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License.

mods:recordInfo.mods:recordOrigin: This MODS record was created using the Islandora XML Forms collection of Drupal modules.

div.head: f 298 (27 January 1612/13) (Pension orders)
div.ab: At this Pencion the Readers ar prised every man 4 li. the Ancientes and such as ar at this tyme to be Called ancientes at 2 li. 10 s. the baristers at 40 s. the Studientes at 20 s. towardes the maske out of which monye so much so much to be Collected as the Inner Temple doth alowe

Mr William Gerrad electted Treasorer ffor the Maske and such thinges to be bought as Master Solicitor shall thinke ffitt and the Prises to be concidered of by the overseers appointed all Prises as they shall alowe of to be paid by Master SolicitorsMaster Solicitor: Francis Bacon warrente

div.head: f 298v (4 February 1612/13)
div.note: euery gentleman to pay his taxacion to the maske, or to loose chamber or expelled.
div.ab: At this Pencion it is Ordered that every gentleman of this societie taxed to the Charge of the Kings Maske having a Chamber in the howse shall not by munday nextmunday next: 8 February 1612/13 pay his taxacion his Chamber is ipso ffacto fforffeated & to be sesed to the vse of the howse and yf any man taxed havinge noe Chamber shall not pay his taxacion as afforesaid is ipso ffacto expulsed the howse

ffurther it is Ordered that if the taxe alredie made for the maske will not be sufficient to discharge the howse same then it is nowe Ordered that at the next Pencion ffurther Order shalbe taken for Leviinge of so much as shalbe suffitient beffore befforbeffore beffor: dittography saterday com senightsaterday com senight: 20 February 1612/13 and a Pencion to be holden one munday nextmunday next: 15 February 1612/13 in that behalffe

div.head: f 299 (8 February 1612/13)
div.note: Voluntary Contribution toward the maske beside the Tax.
div.ab: It is ... agreed at this Pencion that it shalbe concidered what gentlemen are fitt to Contribute voluntary towardes the mask besides the taxe allredi sett & then Collectores to be assined ffor the gatheringe of the voluntary Contribucion

div.head: f 299v (2 March 1612/13)
div.ab: Wher it was Ordered that wheras Mr Hansbie hath lent 40 li. & Mr Wallor & Mr Mosley ether of them 30 li. for the generall vse of Graies Inne towardes the discharginge of the maske that every of these gentlemen shall have ther severall somes of money repaid them againe by the howse at the end of the terme next ensuinge

And it is ffurther Ordered that if any gentlemen shall herafter Lend any money for this purpose that he or thay shall have ther money repaid them againe by the howse at the end of the next terme as afforesaid

It is Ordered at this Pencion that they which ^have not paid their money seaced vppon them towardes the Kinges Maske accordinge to the fformer Order shall pay the same beffore the assention day nextthe assention day next: 13 May 1613 vnto the severalie Collectors therof, vnder Losse of ther Chambers that have Chambers in the howse whether they be howse Chambers or Lease Chambers and vnder paine of Expulsion of such out of the Howse as have noe Chambers, Neverthelesse such as nether are nor shalbe in Commons nor in nor neer the towne this terme nor any part therof shall have Libertie to pay their said moneis vntill the second saterday in the next termethe second ... next terme: 26 June 1613 vppon the penalties afforesaid

div.head: f 300 (12 May 1613)
div.ab: At this Pencion it is Ordered that Mr Barker one of the Readers of this howse shalbe ffreed and discharged from all taxes & paimentes heerafter to be made for and towardes the maske & solemnities in Regard that he hath willingly paid iiij li. accordinge to the Levie mad the Last terme when he was absent

div.head: ff 301-1v(18 May 1613) (Cupboard order)
div.ab: It was Ordered that the gentlemen Late Actors in the maske at the Court shall bring in all ther maskinge apparrel which they had of the Howse Charge at or beffore the first next pencion in the next terme or els the value therof as the Readers then shall thinke ffitt

It is ordered at this Pencion that every one of the Revelors in the Late Maske at the Court shall bringe in ther masking apparrell and deliver it to Sir ffrancis Evre at his Chamber in Graies Inne one Saterdaye nextSaterdaye next: 19 June 1613 or before or els euery one of the said Revelors makinge defavlt therof shall pay vnto the same Sir ffrancis Evre at his Chamber afforesaid the full some xxx li. one Munday nextMunday next: 21 June 1613 before eleven of the Clocke in the forenone to the vse of the Societie of Graies Inne in Leue of the same apparrell or els Incure such censure as may ensue. |

It is also Ordered at this Pencion that wheras by Order mad in Pencion the eight day of Maye 1613 it was Ordained that every gentleman of this Societie then being in Or nere the towne should paye his taxacion imposed vppon him by assencion day then next affter which is now pastassencion ... past: 13 June 1613 and also that every gentleman of this Societie then not in nor nere the Towne so as he by ... intendment Could not have convenient notice in so short a tyme to accomplish the Order afforesaid should Likewyse performe the same by the second saterday in Trinitie terme then next ... insuingethe second ... insuinge: 26 June 1613 which is Likewyse Now past Therfore in respect defavlt is made by divers gentlemen of this Societie as well then present as absent it is Now Ordered at this Pencion that the Pencioner doe ffourthwith execut the said Order ffor Seisinge of Chambers both vppon such as were then absent by reason ther tyme given them is now expired & also vppon those that were then present having not paid ther seuerall taxacions according to ther severall rankes and that without further procrastinacion or delay

div.head: f 302 (22 June 1613)
div.note: for Bringing in the Masking suits
div.ab:
At this Pencion it is allso Ordered that wheras before the Maske Lateley performed at the Court before his Maiestie yt was by the Order of this Howse as by the Orders of all the other Howses of Court amongst them for themselves Ordered that the Maskers should affter the performance of that service bring in ther Maskings suites wherby some profitt might be made of them to ease the great Charge which was expended and in great parte resteth yet vnpaid And wheras the Maskers of the Howse fforbearinge to bringe them in according to the said Order yt was affter the severall answeres of some of them recorded in
or pay 30 li. a peece which cost the house C markes a peece Open pencion againe Ordered that they should bringe them in by a Certaine day of this terme or ells every one of them makinge default to aunswere Thirtie poundes in Leuie therof every of ther said sutes having Cost the Howse above a Hundred Markes which they have Contemptuously neglectted and refused to performe, Albeit none of them did Contribute any thing to the said Charge as also were alowed all other ther necessarie Charges expended theraboutes wherfore for as much as It is not thought ffitt that any gentlemen of this Howse should make profitt of the howse in that manor in particuler as also that if the said Maskinge apparell should not be brought in accordinge to the Order ther must be a generall newe taxacion of the hole howse to paie the severall debtes behind & vnpaide
div.note:
The Maskers refused, although none of them paid toward the tax, & had all theire other charges borne necessarie theraboutes.
therfore put out of Commons &c./
div.ab: It is therfore ordered that everye of the said severale maskers nowe beinge in towne shall for ther said Contemptes be presently Cast into Commons and put out againe and so to Continewe accordinge to the Order of the Howse vntill they ^have performed the said Last Order And that such of them as ^ar now owt of Townes hall performe the same Order at or before Hollamas next at which tyme such of them as shalbe found failinge in the performance of the said Order that is to say aswell those that are Cast into Commons and out againe to the others, are then fourthwith expelled this societie for ther willfull Contemptes of the governmente of this Howse and ther Inconciderate dealinge and the generall wronges to every member therof
It is thought ffitt by these Readers whose names ar vnder written that the draught of the Order towchinge the Maskers apparrell be revewed and the publishinge of it be staied tell ^the next terme
